DOCNAME: CASE OF MALIKA ALIKHADZHIYEVA v. RUSSIA
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 2;Violation of Art. 3;Violation of Art. 5;Violation of Art. 13
JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Elisabeth Steiner;George Nicolaou;Julia Laffranque;Khanlar Hajiyev;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE . She resides in the town of LOC , in GPE . The applicant is the wife of PERSON , born in DATE .
CARDINAL . At the material time , the applicant and PERSON resided at CARDINAL , FAC in LANGUAGE . PERSON brother , PERSON , and his family resided at the same address .
CARDINAL . PERSON had not participated in illegal armed groups since the authorities launched the counter - terrorist operation in GPE in DATE .

CARDINAL . In DATE PERSON , who had been the speaker of ORG ( “ the Parliament of GPE of GPE ” ) in DATE , was abducted from his house and disappeared ( see PERSON v. GPE , no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , DATE ) .

CARDINAL . According to the applicant , PERSON previous involvement in political activities and his ensuing disappearance provoked a heightened interest in their whole family on the part of the domestic authorities . In particular , members of the military commander ’s office of the LOC often came to their house , searched it and checked the family PERSON identity papers .
CARDINAL . PERSON had a silver - grey GPE with licence plate no . A CARDINAL BB CARDINAL . He had acquired it in DATE from his relative , PERSON , in exchange for another car .
CARDINAL . Ruslanbek PERSON was QUANTITY tall .

CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON drove his GPE to PERSON to take a TV set to a repair shop . He gave a lift to ORG A. , who also needed to go to PERSON . PERSON was wearing black velvet trousers and a black shirt with white stripes .
CARDINAL . It appears that at a certain moment PERSON and PERSON . A. parted and the former drove alone back to PERSON .

CARDINAL . At TIME on DATE PERSON car was stopped at the checkpoint of the NORP federal forces located at the intersection of the GPE motorway and FAC , in the vicinity of the village of ORG . The checkpoint was located in the middle of a roundabout . The servicemen at the checkpoint always requested that the vehicles slowed down while passing through . Moreover , there were many holes in the road which also made the drivers slow down while they were passing the area .

CARDINAL . At TIME on DATE the minibus in which ORG was going to PERSON approached the above - mentioned checkpoint . From the minibus PERSON saw that a young man had stopped his silver - grey GPE at the checkpoint and was heading towards the hatch at which the servicemen usually registered the passing drivers . The man was wearing dark trousers and a dark shirt and was QUANTITY tall . A white PERSON vehicle was stationed at the checkpoint nearby . At the moment when the man approached the hatch to present his identity papers for registration , CARDINAL servicemen rushed towards him . CARDINAL servicemen twisted his arms behind his back and the third serviceman handcuffed him . They then took the man inside the checkpoint which was surrounded by blocks and slabs made of concrete .

CARDINAL . M.E. immediately wrote down the numbers on the LOC ’s licence plate which he was able to see : CARDINAL BB CARDINAL . He also asked the minibus driver to stop but the latter refused , saying that if he did so the servicemen could fire on them . According to ORG , his daughter and other passengers of the minibus witnessed the abduction of the man from the LOC .

CARDINAL . At TIME the same day S.T. , PERSON and PERSON , who were driving from PERSON to PERSON , approached the above - mentioned checkpoint . The QUANTITY men were residents of PERSON and personally knew PERSON . They also knew that he had a silver - grey GPE and had seen PERSON drive it on numerous occasions . When the car with the CARDINAL men approached the checkpoint , they saw the silvergrey PERSON , which PERSON immediately recognised as the vehicle belonging to PERSON because he remembered its licence plate numbers . Immediately after that the CARDINAL men saw CARDINAL servicemen get inside PERSON car . A red - haired serviceman who was QUANTITY tall took the driver ’s seat . The second serviceman , who was taller and had a beer can in his hand , took the passenger seat . The CARDINAL men also noticed an ORG which was parked at the checkpoint . Having discussed what they had seen , the CARDINAL men decided that , although the NORP looked like PERSON car and PERSON claimed that it had the same licence plates , they must have been mistaken . They did not stop and drove on . TIME they learnt that PERSON had not returned home because he had been abducted at the checkpoint .

CARDINAL . According to ORG , on DATE , having arrived in PERSON , he went to the town centre where taxi drivers usually gathered . He asked them whether they knew to whom the car with the licence plate he had written down might belong . One of the drivers told him that it could have been owned by a certain resident of ORG . ORG went to that village but did not find the car owner . He returned to PERSON and continued enquiring about the owner of the NORP . According to PERSON , a boy told him that he knew the owners of the car . The boy immediately called somebody over the phone but was unable to obtain the necessary information . ORG then gave him his address in PERSON , so that the relatives of the abducted man could contact him . On TIME the PERSON came to visit PERSON and he told them about the incident he had witnessed at the checkpoint . From the conversation with the PERSON , ORG inferred that the abducted person was PERSON .

CARDINAL . According to the applicant , in TIME on DATE she called her husband on his mobile phone but he did not answer . She waited for him until TIME and then sent her son to Kh . A. to ask for news of her husband . However , Kh . A. was absent and the applicant ’s son returned home without any information .

CARDINAL . Later the same evening the applicant learnt that ORG had received a message from an acquaintance that servicemen at the FAC checkpoint had apprehended a person driving PERSON . A. ’s GPE . That person apparently did not know that Kh . A. and PERSON had exchanged cars and that the PERSON had been owned by the applicant ’s husband since that time . Kh . A. went to see that man who subsequently turned out to be ORG The latter described to ORG A. in detail the circumstances of the Ruslanbek PERSON ’s abduction . On an unspecified date the applicant met PERSON Having talked to him in person and heard his description of the abducted man , she concluded that the person abducted at the ORG checkpoint on DATE had been her husband .
CARDINAL . The applicant has had no news of PERSON since DATE .

CARDINAL . The above account of the events is based on the information contained in the applicant ’s application form ; the applicant ’s written statement of CARDINAL DATE ; a written statement by ORG made on DATE ; written statements by ORG and PERSON made on DATE and a written statement by PERSON made on DATE .

CARDINAL . The Government did not challenge the facts , as presented by the applicant . They claimed that the domestic investigation into the disappearance of PERSON had obtained no evidence that he had been abducted during a security operation .
CARDINAL . On TIME the applicant contacted unspecified local authorities by phone and complained to them about the abduction of her husband .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed written complaints about the abduction of her husband with the prosecutor ’s office and the local police . She submitted that she had not kept copies of those complaints .

CARDINAL . NORP Over DATE the applicant complained about PERSON apprehension to various ORG authorities , seeking assistance in establishing his whereabouts , but did not receive any meaningful information in that respect .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG replied to the applicant that they had examined her request for assistance in the search for PERSON and had forwarded it to the prosecutor of GPE .

CARDINAL . By a letter of CARDINAL DATE the prosecutor ’s office of GPE forwarded the applicant ’s complaint about the abduction of her husband to the prosecutor ’s office of LOC ( “ the district prosecutor ’s office ” ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor ’s office instituted a criminal investigation into the abduction of PERSON under LAW ( abduction ) . The case file was assigned the number DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor ’s office granted the applicant victim status in the proceedings in case no . DATE . The applicant was notified of the decision on DATE . The decision stated , among other things , that on DATE PERSON had driven to PERSON in his PERSON , licence plate no . A CARDINAL BB CARDINAL , in order to take a TV set to a repair shop . When he was returning back to PERSON , unidentified armed persons in camouflage uniforms driving a beige PERSON had stopped his car on a roundabout in the vicinity of ORG . They had abducted PERSON and taken him to an unknown destination .
CARDINAL . It appears that on an unspecified date the investigation in case no . DATE was suspended . There is no indication that the applicant was informed of that decision .

CARDINAL . By a letter of DATE the district prosecutor ’s office informed the applicant that on an unspecified date it had resumed the investigation in case no . DATE and that operational and search measures aimed at establishing PERSON whereabouts and identifying the perpetrators were under way .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant complained to the district prosecutor ’s office that the investigation into the abduction of her husband had yielded no results . She requested that the investigation be resumed if it had been suspended and sought access to the case file and permission to make copies from it in order to have sufficient information for challenging before the courts the decision to suspend the investigation .

CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor ’s office replied to the applicant saying that it had taken all investigative steps which could have been taken in the absence of there being anyone to be charged with the abduction of PERSON and that it thus found no grounds to resume the investigation . As regards the applicant ’s request for access to the case file , she would be provided access to the documents drawn up with her participation .

CARDINAL . Despite the ORG ’s specific requests , the ORG failed to produce most of the documents from criminal case file no . DATE , furnishing only copies of the decisions to open , some of the decisions to suspend and resume the investigation , several witness statements and the investigating authority ’s requests for information to various ORG bodies on the missing man ’s whereabouts or his possible arrest or detention and some of their replies to them . The Government did not provide any explanation for their failure to comply with the ORG ’s request . Some of the documents submitted by the Government were legible only in part . The information contained in those documents may be summarised as follows .

CARDINAL . When giving notice of the present application to the respondent Government , the ORG specifically requested them to provide copies of the applicant ’s complaints about the abduction of her husband , which had prompted the opening of the investigation . In their observations the ORG stated that the district prosecutor ’s office had received the applicant ’s complaint about the abduction of her husband on DATE , without providing any further information . The bulk of the documents submitted by them contained several documents which appear to be relevant to the matter and can be summarised as follows .

CARDINAL . From the documents disclosed by the Government it can be seen that on DATE the applicant complained about the abduction of her husband to the Ombudsman of GPE and that on an unspecified date in DATE her further complaint about his abduction was received by the President of GPE . In both applications the applicant submitted that she had previously complained about the kidnapping of PERSON to a number of ORG authorities , including ORG of the ORG ( ROVD ) and ORG of the Interior , but those authorities had disregarded her submissions .

CARDINAL . By a decision of CARDINAL DATE a prosecutor of the district prosecutor ’s office extended for DATE the time - limit for the preliminary examination of the applicant ’s complaint about the abduction of her husband . The decision stated that the prosecutor had received the applicant ’s complaint about the abduction of her husband on DATE .
CARDINAL . The Government also provided a copy of the applicant ’s complaint to the Shalinskiy ROVD about the abduction of PERSON , dated DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the district prosecutor ’s office instituted an investigation into the abduction of PERSON under LAW of LAW ( aggravated kidnapping ) . The decision stated , among other things , that on DATE PERSON had gone in his GPE , licence plate no . A CARDINAL BB CARDINAL , to ORG to take his TV to a repair centre . On DATE , while PERSON was driving from PERSON to the town of PERSON , unidentified armed persons in camouflage uniforms , who had been driving a beige PERSON , had stopped his car at the roundabout near ORG , had arrested him and taken him to an unknown destination .

CARDINAL . On DATE the investigators interviewed GPE as a witness . He stated that on DATE he had learnt that on the same day PERSON had been abducted by members of the security forces at the checkpoint near ORG . In particular , armed men who had introduced themselves as officers of ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) had stopped his car at the checkpoint , put him into their white armoured PERSON and taken him in the direction of PERSON . They had also taken PERSON car with them . The arrest had been carried out in the presence of servicemen of the checkpoint .
CARDINAL . GPE , who was interviewed on DATE , submitted that she had learnt of the abduction of PERSON at the checkpoint near ORG from GPE and confirmed his account of the events .

CARDINAL . On DATE the investigators interviewed ORG as a witness . He stated that in DATE he had been stationed in GPE and that on DATE he had been on duty at checkpoint no . CARDINAL at the intersection of the roads between PERSON and Mesker - Yurt . At TIME a beige PERSON had arrived at the checkpoint ; ORG did not remember the figures on its licence plate . CARDINAL armed persons in camouflage uniforms had emerged from the vehicle . They had been NORP ; CARDINAL of them had had an NORP appearance . They had introduced themselves as officials of the ORG and asked for assistance in arresting a man driving a Volga . At TIME had stopped the vehicle which interested the men , checked the driver ’s papers and sent the driver to the registration point at the checkpoint . ORG could not remember the man ’s name but would have been able to identify him . While the man had been heading to the registration point , the ORG officers had approached him and asked him to follow them to the PERSON . The man had got into their car and they had got inside it after him . CARDINAL of the ORG officers had got into the man ’s GPE and both vehicles had driven off in the direction of PERSON . The convoy had been followed by a white VAZ-CARDINAL vehicle , also driven by an ORG officer . ORG had not asked the ORG officers why they were arresting the man in the GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the investigators interviewed PERSON as a witness . He stated that he had been stationed in GPE since DATE and that in DATE he had been on duty , together with other servicemen from his unit , at the intersection of the roads between PERSON , PERSON - Yurt and Grozny . At TIME on DATE a beige PERSON had arrived at the checkpoint and CARDINAL men had emerged from it . They had introduced themselves as ORG officers and had produced the relevant certificates indicating that they had been serving in GPE . They had also said that they were there to arrest a certain person but that they did not know when exactly he would appear and that that information was to be communicated to them over the phone . Having spent DATE at the checkpoint they had left in the direction of GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the investigators interviewed the applicant as a witness . She stated that on the evening of DATE a woman had told her that armed men in camouflage uniforms had abducted her husband at the checkpoint near ORG . On DATE he had gone to PERSON to take a TV set to a repair shop . While returning to PERSON , he had been stopped at the checkpoint near ORG . There , while on his way to the registration point , ORG officers from PERSON had arrested him , put him into their white PERSON and driven off in the direction of PERSON . Servicemen at the checkpoint had witnessed the arrest . After the abduction the applicant had applied to ORG in GPE but had received no reply from that authority .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was granted victim status in the proceedings in case no . DATE . While being interviewed on DATE , she confirmed her account of the events given on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the investigators interviewed ORG as a witness . He submitted that on DATE he had been going in a minibus to PERSON . At the checkpoint in LOC he had noticed a man who was standing near a GPE with licence plate no . A CARDINAL BB CARDINAL . The man had been approached by CARDINAL persons in camouflage uniforms . They had twisted his arms and had led him to a light - coloured armoured PERSON , parked nearby and put him inside it . ORG had not seen what had occurred afterwards because the driver of the minibus had told him that he could not stop at the checkpoint . However , ORG had written down the licence plate number of the LOC in order to tell the man ’s relatives of his arrest , should he find them . Once he had arrived in PERSON , PERSON had approached taxi drivers and asked them if they knew who the owner of the vehicle was . They had promised him to ask further and had taken his telephone number and his home address . On TIME the PERSON had come to his house and he had told them about what he had seen at the checkpoint . CARDINAL of the women had told ORG that she was the arrested person ’s wife .
CARDINAL . GPE , interviewed as a witness on DATE , stated that she had learnt of the abduction of PERSON from his relatives on TIME DATE .

DATE . On DATE the investigators interviewed PERSON as a witness . He stated that he occupied the post of the deputy head of ORG of the ORG ( “ the ORG ROVD ” ) and that on DATE he had examined the ROVD materials concerning the abduction of PERSON at the checkpoint in ORG . It followed from those materials and , in particular , the statements of the servicemen who had been on duty at the checkpoint , that the men who had arrested PERSON had introduced themselves as ORG officers from GPE . GPE had subsequently sent all the materials to the district prosecutor ’s office .
CARDINAL . GPE and PERSON , interviewed as witnesses on DATE and DATE , stated that they had learnt of the abduction of PERSON from his relatives .

He stated that on DATE he had been in command of the unit of ORG who had been on duty at the checkpoint near GPE and that his unit also included servicemen A. and ORG The duties of the servicemen from his unit included checking the persons , vehicles and cargo passing through the checkpoint and securing public order in the area . A unit of servicemen of ORG from Primorsk ( “ the ORG unit ” ) was also in charge of the checkpoint together with Zh . Kh . ’s unit . At TIME on DATE a white PERSON had arrived at the checkpoint . Zh . PERSON . had not memorised its licence plate numbers . CARDINAL heavily built armed men in camouflage uniforms had emerged from the vehicle . They had been aged DATE ; CARDINAL of them had had a beard . CARDINAL of them had entered the registration point . At TIME Zh . PERSON . had left for lunch . When he had returned , the ORG officers had told him that the armed men had produced identification to show that they were ORG officers and had arrested at the checkpoint a driver of a NORP whom they had put into their PERSON . CARDINAL of the ORG officers had got inside the GPE and the CARDINAL vehicles had left .
CARDINAL . U.V. , interviewed on DATE gave an account of the events identical to that of Zh . PERSON .

CARDINAL . While being interviewed on DATE , the applicant confirmed her account of the events concerning the abduction of her husband and stated that at DATE a certain ORG had told the mother of PERSON that the latter was in GPE “ in a very bad state ” . The applicant had not met ORG , had not known where he lived and he had contacted only her husband ’s mother , who had died in DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the investigators interviewed Z.A. as a witness . She stated that she had learnt of the circumstances of the abduction of PERSON from residents of PERSON who had passed by the checkpoint near LOC .

CARDINAL . DATE and DATE the investigators requested a number of ORG authorities , including the ORG , ORG , ORG ( “ the UGA ” ) and prosecutor ’s offices of various districts in GPE to provide information on PERSON whereabouts , his possible arrest by those ORG authorities or any special operations conducted with a view to arresting him . It appears that no relevant information was obtained in reply .

On DATE the ORG informed the district prosecutor ’s office that from the information received by them from ORG of ORG of ORG in LOC it followed that at TIME on DATE ORG officers had arrested PERSON at checkpoint no . CARDINAL near FAC with a view to verifying his possible involvement in illegal armed groups and had taken him away in his GazCARDINAL vehicle , licence plate no . A CARDINAL BB PERSON . The letter also stated that PERSON was the brother of a rebel warlord PERSON .

CARDINAL . On DATE the deputy prosecutor of GPE set aside the decision of DATE as unfounded and premature . The decision stated , among other things , that the investigators had failed to interview the head of the PERSON , who had stated in his letter of DATE that PERSON had been arrested on DATE at the checkpoint in ORG by ORG officers from GPE . Moreover , the investigators had not interviewed a certain PERSON . , from whose explanations it followed that PERSON had been arrested by ORG officers . They had likewise failed to interview all relatives and neighbours of PERSON , with whom he could have been staying .
